meanings.definition: To surpass in speed, amount, or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outstrip all other animals in a race.
meanings.sent2: The new technology quickly outstripped the old one.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, hoping to outstrip him this time.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outstrips any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The rocket's speed outstripped all expectations, reaching the moon in record time.

meanings.definition: To leave behind in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: In the marathon, the fastest runner managed to outstrip all the others.
meanings.sent2: The champion sprinter always outstrips his competitors in every race.
meanings.sent3: The snail challenged the rabbit to a race, hoping to outstrip him with a clever shortcut.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win outstrips any doubts she may have had.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed outstripped the wind, leaving a trail of dust behind.
